meanings.definition: To eat the flesh of one's own kind.
meanings.sent1: The hungry lion cannibalises weaker members of its pride.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is taboo to cannibalise one's own species.
meanings.sent3: At the family reunion, Uncle Bob joked that the potluck might turn into a cannibalistic feast!
meanings.sent4: The virus cannibalises healthy cells, spreading its destructive force.
meanings.sent5: The horror movie depicted a tribe that cannibalises its own members for survival.

meanings.definition: To use parts of a machine or system to repair or build another machine or system.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic cannibalises old cars to fix up new ones.
meanings.sent2: When the spaceship broke down, the crew had to cannibalise other equipment to repair it.
meanings.sent3: The robot in the sci-fi movie cannibalised spare parts to build a spaceship.
meanings.sent4: The artist cannibalised broken instruments to create a unique sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The DIY enthusiast cannibalised an old computer to upgrade his gaming setup.

meanings.definition: To take away potential customers, sales, etc., from a similar product or service.
meanings.sent1: The new bakery in town cannibalises the sales of the old one.
meanings.sent2: The online store's discount offers cannibalised the sales of the physical store.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream truck cannibalised the sales of the nearby candy shop.
meanings.sent4: The new smartphone model cannibalised the market share of its predecessor.
meanings.sent5: The popular food truck cannibalised the business of the nearby restaurants.
